alert.note: Alert for Greater Lake Tahoe Area (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 15 at 2:25PM PST until January 16 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST MONDAY... * CHANGES...Updated and lowered expected snowfall totals and shortened warning end time. * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches, except 8 to 16 inches above 7000 feet. * WHERE...Greater Lake Tahoe Area. * WHEN...Until 10 PM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel may be very difficult for the morning and evening commutes. Be sure to check with Caltrans and NDOT for the latest information on chain controls, road conditions, and closures. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snowfall rates are expected Monday morning and afternoon with snow rates tapering down through Monday evening. Isolated lightning strikes are possible Monday afternoon (10% chance).
info.instruction: Avoid travel if possible, you could be stuck in your vehicle for many hours. If you must travel, prepare for long delays and carry an emergency kit with extra food, water and clothing. If you stay home, have a backup plan in case of power outages. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
